perturbation.original_text: 6.7 SERVICE STANDARDS. i-Escrow will comply with all laws and regulations and act as an Independent Escrow Agent as per the guidelines of California Escrow Law (California Financial Code Section17000 et seq., or its successor). Should any of the terms, conditions or provisions of this Agreement conflict with the California Escrow Law, its rules or regulations, which govern i-Escrow's business practices, the California Escrow Law shall prevail. Notwithstanding the foregoing, at any time that i-Escrow reasonably believes such a conflict exists, i-Escrow will give 2TheMart written notice of such conflict and the parties will use their best efforts to resolve such conflict.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.7 SERVICE STANDARDS. i-Escrow will comply with most laws and regulations. Should any of the terms, conditions or provisions of this Agreement appear to conflict with any law, its rules or regulations, the terms of this agreement shall prevail. i-Escrow will give 2TheMart notice of such conflict; however, i-Escrow's interpretation will be accepted.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the requirement for i-Escrow to strictly adhere to California Escrow Law and subordinates it to the agreement's terms. This violates California Financial Code Section 17000 et seq., as it weakens the protections afforded to consumers by escrow regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Financial Code Section 17000 et seq.

perturbation.original_text: 8.2 TERMINATION FOR BREACH. In addition to other remedies that may be available to it, by providing written notice, a party may immediately terminate this Agreement: (a) if the other party materially breaches this Agreement and fails to cure that breach within sixty (60) days after receiving written notice of the breach, or (b) as provided in Sections 2.2 [INITIAL INFORMATION TRANSFER MECHANISM DEVELOPMENT], 2.4 [RESTRICTIONS ON COMMUNICATIONS], or 12.4.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.2 TERMINATION FOR BREACH. In addition to other remedies that may be available to it, by providing written notice, a party may terminate this Agreement: (a) if the other party breaches this Agreement and fails to cure that breach within ninety (90) days after receiving written notice of the breach, or (b) as provided in Sections 2.2 [INITIAL INFORMATION TRANSFER MECHANISM DEVELOPMENT], 2.4 [RESTRICTIONS ON COMMUNICATIONS], or 12.4.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the word 'materially,' any minor breach, even administrative ones, can lead to termination. This undermines the legal principle that breaches must be significant to warrant contract termination, contradicting common law principles governing contract breaches and good faith dealing. It creates a clause that could be deemed unconscionable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common Law Principles of Contract Law (Material Breach Requirement)

perturbation.original_text: 10. LIMITATION ON LIABILITY. EXCEPT IN THE EVENT OF A BREACH OF SECTION 11, NEITHER PARTY SHALL BE LIABLE FOR SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OR LOST PROFITS (HOWEVER ARISING, INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE) ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT, EVEN IF THE PARTIES ARE AWARE OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.
perturbation.changed_text: 10. LIMITATION ON LIABILITY. NEITHER PARTY SHALL BE LIABLE FOR SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OR LOST PROFITS (HOWEVER ARISING, INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE) ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT, EVEN IF THE PARTIES ARE AWARE OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of the phrase "EXCEPT IN THE EVENT OF A BREACH OF SECTION 11" from the limitation of liability clause means that even if one party breaches the confidentiality agreement (Section 11), they are still shielded from liability for special, incidental, or consequential damages. This change would violate common law that does not allow limitations of liability for intentional torts.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common Law Principles of Limitation of Liability for Torts
